trans-unit.source: Debug Hadoop in HDInsight: View logs and interpret error messages | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Debug Hadoop in HDInsight: View logs and interpret error messages | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the error messages you might receive when administering HDInsight using PowerShell, and steps you can take to recover.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the error messages you might receive when administering HDInsight using PowerShell, and steps you can take to recover.

trans-unit.source: Analyze HDInsight logs
trans-unit.target: Analyze HDInsight logs

trans-unit.source: Each Hadoop cluster in Azure HDInsight has an Azure storage account used as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Each Hadoop cluster in Azure HDInsight has an Azure storage account used as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is referred as the default Storage account.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is referred as the default Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Cluster uses the Azure Table storage and the Blob storage on the default Storage account to store its logs.
trans-unit.target: Cluster uses the Azure Table storage and the Blob storage on the default Storage account to store its logs.

trans-unit.source: To find out the default storage account for your cluster, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#find-the-default-storage-account).
trans-unit.target: To find out the default storage account for your cluster, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#find-the-default-storage-account).

trans-unit.source: The logs retain in the Storage account even after the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The logs retain in the Storage account even after the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: Logs written to Azure Tables
trans-unit.target: Logs written to Azure Tables

trans-unit.source: The logs written to Azure Tables provide one level of insight into what is happening with an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The logs written to Azure Tables provide one level of insight into what is happening with an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: When you create an HDInsight cluster, 6 tables are automatically created for Linux-based clusters in the default Table storage:
trans-unit.target: When you create an HDInsight cluster, 6 tables are automatically created for Linux-based clusters in the default Table storage:

trans-unit.source: hdinsightagentlog
trans-unit.target: hdinsightagentlog

trans-unit.source: syslog
trans-unit.target: syslog

trans-unit.source: daemonlog
trans-unit.target: daemonlog

trans-unit.source: hadoopservicelog
trans-unit.target: hadoopservicelog

trans-unit.source: ambariserverlog
trans-unit.target: ambariserverlog

trans-unit.source: ambariagentlog
trans-unit.target: ambariagentlog

trans-unit.source: 3 tables are created for Windows-based clusters:
trans-unit.target: 3 tables are created for Windows-based clusters:

trans-unit.source: setuplog: Log of events/exceptions encountered in provisioning/setting up of HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: setuplog: Log of events/exceptions encountered in provisioning/setting up of HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: hadoopinstalllog: Log of events/exceptions encountered when installing Hadoop on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: hadoopinstalllog: Log of events/exceptions encountered when installing Hadoop on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This table may be useful in debugging issues related to clusters created with custom parameters.
trans-unit.target: This table may be useful in debugging issues related to clusters created with custom parameters.

trans-unit.source: hadoopservicelog: Log of events/exceptions recorded by all Hadoop services.
trans-unit.target: hadoopservicelog: Log of events/exceptions recorded by all Hadoop services.

trans-unit.source: This table may be useful in debugging issues related to job failures on HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: This table may be useful in debugging issues related to job failures on HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: The table file names are **u<ClusterName>DDMonYYYYatHHMMSSsss<TableName>**.
trans-unit.target: The table file names are **u<ClusterName>DDMonYYYYatHHMMSSsss<TableName>**.

trans-unit.source: These tables contains the following fields:
trans-unit.target: These tables contains the following fields:

trans-unit.source: ClusterDnsName
trans-unit.target: ClusterDnsName

trans-unit.source: ComponentName
trans-unit.target: ComponentName

trans-unit.source: EventTimestamp
trans-unit.target: EventTimestamp

trans-unit.source: Host
trans-unit.target: Host

trans-unit.source: MALoggingHash
trans-unit.target: MALoggingHash

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: N
trans-unit.target: N

trans-unit.source: PreciseTimeStamp
trans-unit.target: PreciseTimeStamp

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: RowIndex
trans-unit.target: RowIndex

trans-unit.source: Tenant
trans-unit.target: Tenant

trans-unit.source: TIMESTAMP
trans-unit.target: TIMESTAMP

trans-unit.source: TraceLevel
trans-unit.target: TraceLevel

trans-unit.source: Tools for accessing the logs
trans-unit.target: Tools for accessing the logs

trans-unit.source: There are many tools available for accessing data in these tables:
trans-unit.target: There are many tools available for accessing data in these tables:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: Power Query for Excel
trans-unit.target: Power Query for Excel

trans-unit.source: Use Power Query for Excel
trans-unit.target: Use Power Query for Excel

trans-unit.source: Power Query can be installed from [www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39379]( http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39379).
trans-unit.target: Power Query can be installed from [www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39379]( http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39379).

trans-unit.source: See the download page for the system requirements
trans-unit.target: See the download page for the system requirements

trans-unit.source: **To use Power Query to open and analyze the service log**
trans-unit.target: **To use Power Query to open and analyze the service log**

trans-unit.source: Open **Microsoft Excel**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Microsoft Excel**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Power Query** menu, click **From Azure**, and then click **From Microsoft Azure Table storage**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Power Query** menu, click **From Azure**, and then click **From Microsoft Azure Table storage**.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop Excel PowerQuery open Azure Table storage](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-using-excel-power-query-open.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop Excel PowerQuery open Azure Table storage](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-using-excel-power-query-open.png)

trans-unit.source: Enter the storage account name.
trans-unit.target: Enter the storage account name.

trans-unit.source: This can be either the short name or the FQDN.
trans-unit.target: This can be either the short name or the FQDN.

trans-unit.source: Enter the storage account key.
trans-unit.target: Enter the storage account key.

trans-unit.source: You shall see a list of tables:
trans-unit.target: You shall see a list of tables:

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs stored in Azure Table storage](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-table-names.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs stored in Azure Table storage](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-table-names.png)

trans-unit.source: Right-click the hadoopservicelog table in the **Navigator** pane and select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the hadoopservicelog table in the **Navigator** pane and select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: You shall see 4 columns.
trans-unit.target: You shall see 4 columns.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, delete the **Partition Key**, **Row Key**, and **Timestamp** columns by selecting them, then clicking **Remove Columns** from the options in the ribbon.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, delete the **Partition Key**, **Row Key**, and **Timestamp** columns by selecting them, then clicking **Remove Columns** from the options in the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Click the expand icon on the Content column to choose the columns you want to import into the Excel spreadsheet.
trans-unit.target: Click the expand icon on the Content column to choose the columns you want to import into the Excel spreadsheet.

trans-unit.source: For this demonstration, I chose TraceLevel, and ComponentName: It can give me some basic information on which components had issues.
trans-unit.target: For this demonstration, I chose TraceLevel, and ComponentName: It can give me some basic information on which components had issues.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs choose columns](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-using-excel-power-query-filter.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs choose columns](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-using-excel-power-query-filter.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to import the data.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to import the data.

trans-unit.source: Select the **TraceLevel**, Role, and **ComponentName** columns, and then click **Group By** control in the ribbon.
trans-unit.target: Select the **TraceLevel**, Role, and **ComponentName** columns, and then click **Group By** control in the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** in the Group By dialog box
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** in the Group By dialog box

trans-unit.source: Click** Apply & Close**.
trans-unit.target: Click** Apply & Close**.

trans-unit.source: You can now use Excel to filter and sort as necessary.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Excel to filter and sort as necessary.

trans-unit.source: Obviously, you may want to include other columns (e.g. Message) in order to drill down into issues when they occur, but selecting and grouping the columns described above provides a decent picture of what is happening with Hadoop services.
trans-unit.target: Obviously, you may want to include other columns (e.g. Message) in order to drill down into issues when they occur, but selecting and grouping the columns described above provides a decent picture of what is happening with Hadoop services.

trans-unit.source: The same idea can be applied to the setuplog and hadoopinstalllog tables.
trans-unit.target: The same idea can be applied to the setuplog and hadoopinstalllog tables.

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: **To use Visual Studio**
trans-unit.target: **To use Visual Studio**

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: From the **View** menu, click **Cloud Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: From the **View** menu, click **Cloud Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Or simply click **CTRL+\, CTRL+X**.
trans-unit.target: Or simply click **CTRL+\, CTRL+X**.

trans-unit.source: From **Cloud Explorer**, select **Resource Types**.
trans-unit.target: From **Cloud Explorer**, select **Resource Types**.

trans-unit.source: The other available option is **Resource Groups**.
trans-unit.target: The other available option is **Resource Groups**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Storage Accounts**, the default storage account for your cluster, and then **Tables**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Storage Accounts**, the default storage account for your cluster, and then **Tables**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click hadoopservicelog.
trans-unit.target: Double-click hadoopservicelog.

trans-unit.source: Add a filter.
trans-unit.target: Add a filter.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs choose columns](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-visual-studio-filter.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop logs choose columns](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdinsight-hadoop-analyze-logs-visual-studio-filter.png)

trans-unit.source: For more information about constructing filters, see [Constructing Filter Strings for the Table Designer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff683669.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about constructing filters, see [Constructing Filter Strings for the Table Designer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff683669.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Logs Written to Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Logs Written to Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: [The logs written to Azure Tables](#log-written-to-azure-tables) provide one level of insight into what is happening with an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [The logs written to Azure Tables](#log-written-to-azure-tables) provide one level of insight into what is happening with an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: However, these tables do not provide task-level logs, which can be helpful in drilling further into issues when they occur.
trans-unit.target: However, these tables do not provide task-level logs, which can be helpful in drilling further into issues when they occur.

trans-unit.source: To provide this next level of detail, HDInsight clusters are configured to write task logs to your Blob Storage account for any job that is submitted through Templeton.
trans-unit.target: To provide this next level of detail, HDInsight clusters are configured to write task logs to your Blob Storage account for any job that is submitted through Templeton.

trans-unit.source: Practically, this means jobs submitted using the Microsoft Azure PowerShell cmdlets or the .NET Job Submission APIs, not jobs submitted through RDP/command-line access to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Practically, this means jobs submitted using the Microsoft Azure PowerShell cmdlets or the .NET Job Submission APIs, not jobs submitted through RDP/command-line access to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: To view the logs, see [Access YARN application logs on Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-access-yarn-app-logs-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: To view the logs, see [Access YARN application logs on Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-access-yarn-app-logs-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information about application logs, see [Simplifying user-logs management and access in YARN](http://hortonworks.com/blog/simplifying-user-logs-management-and-access-in-yarn/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about application logs, see [Simplifying user-logs management and access in YARN](http://hortonworks.com/blog/simplifying-user-logs-management-and-access-in-yarn/).

trans-unit.source: View cluster health and job logs
trans-unit.target: View cluster health and job logs

trans-unit.source: Access Hadoop UI
trans-unit.target: Access Hadoop UI

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight cluster name to open the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight cluster name to open the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: ![Launch cluster dashboard](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-launch-dashboard.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Launch cluster dashboard](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-launch-dashboard.png)

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: In the Query Console that opens, click **Hadoop UI**.
trans-unit.target: In the Query Console that opens, click **Hadoop UI**.

trans-unit.source: ![Start Hadoop UI](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-launch-dashboard-hadoop-ui.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Start Hadoop UI](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-launch-dashboard-hadoop-ui.png)

trans-unit.source: Access the Yarn UI
trans-unit.target: Access the Yarn UI

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight cluster name to open the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight cluster name to open the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: In the Query Console that opens, click **YARN UI**.
trans-unit.target: In the Query Console that opens, click **YARN UI**.

trans-unit.source: You can use the YARN UI to do the following:
trans-unit.target: You can use the YARN UI to do the following:

trans-unit.source: **Get cluster status**.
trans-unit.target: **Get cluster status**.

trans-unit.source: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and click **About**.
trans-unit.target: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and click **About**.

trans-unit.source: This present cluster status details like total allocated memory, cores used, state of the cluster resource manager, cluster version etc.
trans-unit.target: This present cluster status details like total allocated memory, cores used, state of the cluster resource manager, cluster version etc.

trans-unit.source: ![Launch cluster dashboard](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-yarn-cluster-state.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Launch cluster dashboard](./media/hdinsight-debug-jobs/hdi-debug-yarn-cluster-state.png)

trans-unit.source: **Get node status**.
trans-unit.target: **Get node status**.

trans-unit.source: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and click **Nodes**.
trans-unit.target: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and click **Nodes**.

trans-unit.source: This lists all the nodes in the cluster, HTTP address of each node, resources allocated to each node, etc.
trans-unit.target: This lists all the nodes in the cluster, HTTP address of each node, resources allocated to each node, etc.

trans-unit.source: **Monitor job status**.
trans-unit.target: **Monitor job status**.

trans-unit.source: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and then click **Applications** to list all the jobs in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: From the left pane, expand **Cluster**, and then click **Applications** to list all the jobs in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you want to look at jobs in a specific state (such as new, submitted, running, etc.), click the appropriate link under **Applications**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to look at jobs in a specific state (such as new, submitted, running, etc.), click the appropriate link under **Applications**.

trans-unit.source: You can further click the job name to find out more about the job such including the output, logs, etc.
trans-unit.target: You can further click the job name to find out more about the job such including the output, logs, etc.

trans-unit.source: Access the HBase UI
trans-unit.target: Access the HBase UI

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight HBase cluster name to open the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Portal, click an HDInsight HBase cluster name to open the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: From the cluster blade, click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the cluster administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: In the Query Console that opens, click **HBase UI**.
trans-unit.target: In the Query Console that opens, click **HBase UI**.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight error codes
trans-unit.target: HDInsight error codes

trans-unit.source: The error messages itemized in this section are provided to help the users of Hadoop in Azure HDInsight understand possible error conditions that they can encounter when administering the service using Azure PowerShell and to advise them on the steps which can be taken to recover from the error.
trans-unit.target: The error messages itemized in this section are provided to help the users of Hadoop in Azure HDInsight understand possible error conditions that they can encounter when administering the service using Azure PowerShell and to advise them on the steps which can be taken to recover from the error.

trans-unit.source: Some of these error messages could also be seen in the Azure Portal when it is used to manage HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Some of these error messages could also be seen in the Azure Portal when it is used to manage HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: But other error messages you might encounter there are less granular due to the constraints on the remedial actions possible in this context.
trans-unit.target: But other error messages you might encounter there are less granular due to the constraints on the remedial actions possible in this context.

trans-unit.source: Other error messages are provided in the contexts where the mitigation is obvious.
trans-unit.target: Other error messages are provided in the contexts where the mitigation is obvious.

trans-unit.source: AtleastOneSqlMetastoreMustBeProvided
trans-unit.target: AtleastOneSqlMetastoreMustBeProvided

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Please provide Azure SQL database details for at least one component in order to use custom settings for Hive and Oozie metastores.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Please provide Azure SQL database details for at least one component in order to use custom settings for Hive and Oozie metastores.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: The user needs to supply a valid SQL Azure metastore and retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: The user needs to supply a valid SQL Azure metastore and retry the request.

trans-unit.source: AzureRegionNotSupported
trans-unit.target: AzureRegionNotSupported

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Could not create cluster in region *nameOfYourRegion*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Could not create cluster in region *nameOfYourRegion*.

trans-unit.source: Use a valid HDInsight region and retry request.
trans-unit.target: Use a valid HDInsight region and retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Customer should create the cluster region that currently supports them: Southeast Asia, West Europe, North Europe, East US, or West US.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Customer should create the cluster region that currently supports them: Southeast Asia, West Europe, North Europe, East US, or West US.

trans-unit.source: ClusterContainerRecordNotFound
trans-unit.target: ClusterContainerRecordNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: The server could not find the requested cluster record.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: The server could not find the requested cluster record.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: ClusterDnsNameInvalidReservedWord
trans-unit.target: ClusterDnsNameInvalidReservedWord

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster DNS name *yourDnsName* is invalid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster DNS name *yourDnsName* is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure name starts and ends with alphanumeric and can only contain '-' special character
trans-unit.target: Please ensure name starts and ends with alphanumeric and can only contain '-' special character

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Make sure that you have used a valid DNS name for your cluster that starts and ends with alphanumeric and contains no special characters other than the dash '-' and then retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Make sure that you have used a valid DNS name for your cluster that starts and ends with alphanumeric and contains no special characters other than the dash '-' and then retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: ClusterNameUnavailable
trans-unit.target: ClusterNameUnavailable

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster name *yourClusterName* is unavailable.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster name *yourClusterName* is unavailable.

trans-unit.source: Please pick another name.
trans-unit.target: Please pick another name.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: The user should specify a clustername that is unique and does not exist and retry.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: The user should specify a clustername that is unique and does not exist and retry.

trans-unit.source: If the user is using the Portal, the UI will notify them if a cluster name is already being used during the create steps.
trans-unit.target: If the user is using the Portal, the UI will notify them if a cluster name is already being used during the create steps.

trans-unit.source: ClusterPasswordInvalid
trans-unit.target: ClusterPasswordInvalid

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster password is invalid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster password is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Password must be at least 10 characters long and must contain at least one number, uppercase letter, lowercase letter and special character with no spaces and should not contain the username as part of it.
trans-unit.target: Password must be at least 10 characters long and must contain at least one number, uppercase letter, lowercase letter and special character with no spaces and should not contain the username as part of it.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid cluster password and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid cluster password and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: ClusterUserNameInvalid
trans-unit.target: ClusterUserNameInvalid

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster username is invalid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster username is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure username doesn't contain special characters or spaces.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure username doesn't contain special characters or spaces.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid cluster username and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid cluster username and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: ClusterUserNameInvalidReservedWord
trans-unit.target: ClusterUserNameInvalidReservedWord

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster DNS name *yourDnsClusterName* is invalid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster DNS name *yourDnsClusterName* is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure name starts and ends with alphanumeric and can only contain '-' special character
trans-unit.target: Please ensure name starts and ends with alphanumeric and can only contain '-' special character

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid DNS cluster username and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Provide a valid DNS cluster username and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: ContainerNameMisMatchWithDnsName
trans-unit.target: ContainerNameMisMatchWithDnsName

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Container name in URI *yourcontainerURI* and DNS name *yourDnsName* in request body must be the same.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Container name in URI *yourcontainerURI* and DNS name *yourDnsName* in request body must be the same.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Make sure that your container Name and your DNS name are the same and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Make sure that your container Name and your DNS name are the same and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: DataNodeDefinitionNotFound
trans-unit.target: DataNodeDefinitionNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.

trans-unit.source: Unable to find any data node definitions in node size.
trans-unit.target: Unable to find any data node definitions in node size.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: DeploymentDeletionFailure
trans-unit.target: DeploymentDeletionFailure

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Deletion of deployment failed for the Cluster
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Deletion of deployment failed for the Cluster

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the delete operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the delete operation.

trans-unit.source: DnsMappingNotFound
trans-unit.target: DnsMappingNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Service configuration error.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Service configuration error.

trans-unit.source: Required DNS mapping information not found.
trans-unit.target: Required DNS mapping information not found.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Delete cluster and create a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Delete cluster and create a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: DuplicateClusterContainerRequest
trans-unit.target: DuplicateClusterContainerRequest

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Duplicate cluster container creation attempt.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Duplicate cluster container creation attempt.

trans-unit.source: Record exists for *nameOfYourContainer* but Etags do not match.
trans-unit.target: Record exists for *nameOfYourContainer* but Etags do not match.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Provide a unique name for the container and retry the create operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Provide a unique name for the container and retry the create operation.

trans-unit.source: DuplicateClusterInHostedService
trans-unit.target: DuplicateClusterInHostedService

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Hosted service *nameOfYourHostedService* already contains a cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Hosted service *nameOfYourHostedService* already contains a cluster.

trans-unit.source: A hosted service cannot contain multiple clusters
trans-unit.target: A hosted service cannot contain multiple clusters

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Host the cluster in another hosted service.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Host the cluster in another hosted service.

trans-unit.source: FailureToUpdateDeploymentStatus
trans-unit.target: FailureToUpdateDeploymentStatus

trans-unit.source: **Description**: The server could not update the state of the cluster deployment.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: The server could not update the state of the cluster deployment.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: If this happens multiple times, contact CSS.
trans-unit.target: If this happens multiple times, contact CSS.

trans-unit.source: HdiRestoreClusterAltered
trans-unit.target: HdiRestoreClusterAltered

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Cluster *yourClusterName* was deleted as part of maintenance.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Cluster *yourClusterName* was deleted as part of maintenance.

trans-unit.source: Please recreate the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Please recreate the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Recreate the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Recreate the cluster.

trans-unit.source: HeadNodeConfigNotFound
trans-unit.target: HeadNodeConfigNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.

trans-unit.source: Required head node configuration not found in node sizes.
trans-unit.target: Required head node configuration not found in node sizes.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: HostedServiceCreationFailure
trans-unit.target: HostedServiceCreationFailure

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Unable to create hosted service *nameOfYourHostedService*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Unable to create hosted service *nameOfYourHostedService*.

trans-unit.source: Please retry request.
trans-unit.target: Please retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: HostedServiceHasProductionDeployment
trans-unit.target: HostedServiceHasProductionDeployment

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* already has a production deployment.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* already has a production deployment.

trans-unit.source: A hosted service cannot contain multiple production deployments.
trans-unit.target: A hosted service cannot contain multiple production deployments.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request with a different cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request with a different cluster name.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Use a different cluster name and retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Use a different cluster name and retry the request.

trans-unit.source: HostedServiceNotFound
trans-unit.target: HostedServiceNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* for the cluster could not be found.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* for the cluster could not be found.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, delete it and then try again.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, delete it and then try again.

trans-unit.source: HostedServiceWithNoDeployment
trans-unit.target: HostedServiceWithNoDeployment

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* has no associated deployment.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Hosted Service *nameOfYourHostedService* has no associated deployment.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, delete it and then try again.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, delete it and then try again.

trans-unit.source: InsufficientResourcesCores
trans-unit.target: InsufficientResourcesCores

trans-unit.source: **Description**: The SubscriptionId *yourSubscriptionId* does not have cores left to create cluster *yourClusterName*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: The SubscriptionId *yourSubscriptionId* does not have cores left to create cluster *yourClusterName*.

trans-unit.source: Required: *resourcesRequired*, Available: *resourcesAvailable*.
trans-unit.target: Required: *resourcesRequired*, Available: *resourcesAvailable*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Free up resources in your subscription or increase the resources available to the subscription and try to create the cluster again.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Free up resources in your subscription or increase the resources available to the subscription and try to create the cluster again.

trans-unit.source: InsufficientResourcesHostedServices
trans-unit.target: InsufficientResourcesHostedServices

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* does not have quota for a new HostedService to create cluster *yourClusterName*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* does not have quota for a new HostedService to create cluster *yourClusterName*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Free up resources in your subscription or increase the resources available to the subscription and try to create the cluster again.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Free up resources in your subscription or increase the resources available to the subscription and try to create the cluster again.

trans-unit.source: InternalErrorRetryRequest
trans-unit.target: InternalErrorRetryRequest

trans-unit.source: **Description**: The server encountered an internal error.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: The server encountered an internal error.

trans-unit.source: Please retry request.
trans-unit.target: Please retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: InvalidAzureStorageLocation
trans-unit.target: InvalidAzureStorageLocation

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Azure Storage location *dataRegionName* is not a valid location.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Azure Storage location *dataRegionName* is not a valid location.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the region is correct and retry request.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the region is correct and retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Select a Storage location that supports HDInsight, check that your cluster is co-located and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Select a Storage location that supports HDInsight, check that your cluster is co-located and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: InvalidNodeSizeForDataNode
trans-unit.target: InvalidNodeSizeForDataNode

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid VM size for data nodes.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid VM size for data nodes.

trans-unit.source: Only 'Large VM' size is supported for all data nodes.
trans-unit.target: Only 'Large VM' size is supported for all data nodes.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify the supported node size for the data node and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify the supported node size for the data node and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: InvalidNodeSizeForHeadNode
trans-unit.target: InvalidNodeSizeForHeadNode

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid VM size for head node.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid VM size for head node.

trans-unit.source: Only 'ExtraLarge VM' size is supported for head node.
trans-unit.target: Only 'ExtraLarge VM' size is supported for head node.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify the supported node size for the head node and retry the operation
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify the supported node size for the head node and retry the operation

trans-unit.source: InvalidRightsForDeploymentDeletion
trans-unit.target: InvalidRightsForDeploymentDeletion

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* being used does not have sufficient permissions to execute delete operation for cluster *yourClusterName*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* being used does not have sufficient permissions to execute delete operation for cluster *yourClusterName*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, drop it and then try again.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: If the cluster is in error state, drop it and then try again.

trans-unit.source: InvalidStorageAccountBlobContainerName
trans-unit.target: InvalidStorageAccountBlobContainerName

trans-unit.source: **Description**: External storage account blob container name *yourContainerName* is invalid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: External storage account blob container name *yourContainerName* is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Make sure name starts with a letter and contains only lowercase letters, numbers and dash.
trans-unit.target: Make sure name starts with a letter and contains only lowercase letters, numbers and dash.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid storage account blob container name and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid storage account blob container name and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: InvalidStorageAccountConfigurationSecretKey
trans-unit.target: InvalidStorageAccountConfigurationSecretKey

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Configuration for external storage account *yourStorageAccountName* is required to have secret key details to be set.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Configuration for external storage account *yourStorageAccountName* is required to have secret key details to be set.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid secret key for the storage account and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid secret key for the storage account and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: InvalidVersionHeaderFormat
trans-unit.target: InvalidVersionHeaderFormat

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Version header *yourVersionHeader* is not in valid format of yyyy-mm-dd.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Version header *yourVersionHeader* is not in valid format of yyyy-mm-dd.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid format for the version-header and retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid format for the version-header and retry the request.

trans-unit.source: MoreThanOneHeadNode
trans-unit.target: MoreThanOneHeadNode

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.

trans-unit.source: Found more than one head node configuration.
trans-unit.target: Found more than one head node configuration.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Edit the configuration so that onloy one head node is specified.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Edit the configuration so that onloy one head node is specified.

trans-unit.source: OperationTimedOutRetryRequest
trans-unit.target: OperationTimedOutRetryRequest

trans-unit.source: **Description**: The operation could not be completed within the permitted time or the maximum retry attempts possible.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: The operation could not be completed within the permitted time or the maximum retry attempts possible.

trans-unit.source: Please retry request.
trans-unit.target: Please retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: ParameterNullOrEmpty
trans-unit.target: ParameterNullOrEmpty

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Parameter *yourParameterName* cannot be null or empty.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Parameter *yourParameterName* cannot be null or empty.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid value for the parameter.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify a valid value for the parameter.

trans-unit.source: PreClusterCreationValidationFailure
trans-unit.target: PreClusterCreationValidationFailure

trans-unit.source: **Description**: One or more of the cluster creation request inputs is not valid.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: One or more of the cluster creation request inputs is not valid.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the input values are correct and retry request.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the input values are correct and retry request.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Make sure the input values are correct and retry request.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Make sure the input values are correct and retry request.

trans-unit.source: RegionCapabilityNotAvailable
trans-unit.target: RegionCapabilityNotAvailable

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Region capability not available for region *yourRegionName* and Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Region capability not available for region *yourRegionName* and Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Specify a region that supports HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Specify a region that supports HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: The publicly supported regions are: Southeast Asia, West Europe, North Europe, East US, or West US.
trans-unit.target: The publicly supported regions are: Southeast Asia, West Europe, North Europe, East US, or West US.

trans-unit.source: StorageAccountNotColocated
trans-unit.target: StorageAccountNotColocated

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Storage account *yourStorageAccountName* is in region *currentRegionName*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Storage account *yourStorageAccountName* is in region *currentRegionName*.

trans-unit.source: It should be same as the cluster region *yourClusterRegionName*.
trans-unit.target: It should be same as the cluster region *yourClusterRegionName*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Either specify a storage account in the same region that your cluster is in or if your data is already in the storage account, create a new cluster in the same region as the existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Either specify a storage account in the same region that your cluster is in or if your data is already in the storage account, create a new cluster in the same region as the existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the Portal, the UI will notify them of this issue in advance.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the Portal, the UI will notify them of this issue in advance.

trans-unit.source: SubscriptionIdNotActive
trans-unit.target: SubscriptionIdNotActive

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Given Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* is not active.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Given Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* is not active.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Re-activate your subscription or get a new valid subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Re-activate your subscription or get a new valid subscription.

trans-unit.source: SubscriptionIdNotFound
trans-unit.target: SubscriptionIdNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* could not be found.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId* could not be found.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Check that your subscription ID is valid and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Check that your subscription ID is valid and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: UnableToResolveDNS
trans-unit.target: UnableToResolveDNS

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Unable to resolve DNS *yourDnsUrl*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Unable to resolve DNS *yourDnsUrl*.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure the fully qualified URL for the blob endpoint is provided.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure the fully qualified URL for the blob endpoint is provided.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Supply a valid blob URL.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Supply a valid blob URL.

trans-unit.source: The URL MUST be fully valid, including starting with *http://* and ending in *.com*.
trans-unit.target: The URL MUST be fully valid, including starting with *http://* and ending in *.com*.

trans-unit.source: UnableToVerifyLocationOfResource
trans-unit.target: UnableToVerifyLocationOfResource

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Unable to verify location of resource *yourDnsUrl*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Unable to verify location of resource *yourDnsUrl*.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure the fully qualified URL for the blob endpoint is provided.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure the fully qualified URL for the blob endpoint is provided.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Supply a valid blob URL.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Supply a valid blob URL.

trans-unit.source: The URL MUST be fully valid, including starting with *http://* and ending in *.com*.
trans-unit.target: The URL MUST be fully valid, including starting with *http://* and ending in *.com*.

trans-unit.source: VersionCapabilityNotAvailable
trans-unit.target: VersionCapabilityNotAvailable

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Version capability not available for version *specifiedVersion* and Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Version capability not available for version *specifiedVersion* and Subscription ID *yourSubscriptionId*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is available and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is available and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: VersionNotSupported
trans-unit.target: VersionNotSupported

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Version *specifiedVersion* not supported.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Version *specifiedVersion* not supported.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is supported and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is supported and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: VersionNotSupportedInRegion
trans-unit.target: VersionNotSupportedInRegion

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Version *specifiedVersion* is not available in Azure region *specifiedRegion*.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Version *specifiedVersion* is not available in Azure region *specifiedRegion*.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is supported in the region specified and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Choose a version that is supported in the region specified and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: WasbAccountConfigNotFound
trans-unit.target: WasbAccountConfigNotFound

trans-unit.source: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Description**: Invalid cluster configuration.

trans-unit.source: Required WASB account configuration not found in external accounts.
trans-unit.target: Required WASB account configuration not found in external accounts.

trans-unit.source: **Mitigation**: Verify that the account exists and is properly specified in configuration and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: **Mitigation**: Verify that the account exists and is properly specified in configuration and retry the operation.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
